intro: Osteospermum rubens, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, daisy-like blooms with bright yellow centers and white or pink petals. Osteospermum rubens typically grows as an upright shrub with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
